version_changes.summary: Directory structure reorganized (iceoryx2-bb-* -> iceoryx2-bb/*), MSRV increased to 1.83, union types now supported in ZeroCopySend
key_changes: Union keyword now used in FFI layer for C bindings
no_std support added - explicit core/alloc imports

findings.summary: Program text uses Unicode; defines whitespace and ASCII characters

non_ascii_identifiers.note: All identifiers in iceoryx2 are ASCII-only

unicode_escapes_in_strings.note: No \u{...} escape sequences found in production code

division.safety_note: REVIEW - potential panic on zero divisor

modulo.safety_note: REVIEW - potential panic on zero divisor

exclusive_range.note: Used in struct update syntax and slicing

findings.safety_relevance: MEDIUM - Division and modulo require zero-divisor review

findings.summary: Identifier syntax, Unicode normalization, raw identifiers

raw_identifiers.note: No r# raw identifiers found in iceoryx2

suppress_warning.purpose: Suppress unused variable warnings, keep binding for RAII

samples.code: b'<' => return true, b'>' => return true, b'"' => return true, ...
const RELATIVE_LOCAL_CONFIG_PATH: &[u8] = b"config"; const RELATIVE_CONFIG_FILE_PATH: &[u8] = b"iceoryx2";
b"" => return true, b"." => return true, b".." => return true,

binary_literals.purpose: Bit flags with clear positional meaning for port state

samples.code: let mut mode = if arg & O_NONBLOCK != 0 { 1u32 } else { 0u32 };

underscore_separators.note: No underscore digit separators found in production code

samples.code: let relative_prio: f32 = (priority as f32 / u8::MAX as f32).clamp(0.0, 1.0);

suffixes_used.note: All floats are unsuffixed, type inferred from context

float_literals.safety_note: MINIMAL FLOAT USE - Could be refactored to fixed-point for ASIL B

subsection_2_4_5_character_literals.note: char literals not used directly; byte literals (b'x') used instead for ASCII

simple_strings.note: ELIDED - Ubiquitous for error messages, documentation strings

findings.note: ELIDED - Comments are ubiquitous. Well-documented codebase.

async_await.safety_note: NOT USED - async/await avoided for determinism in safety-critical code

dyn_keyword.safety_note: Increased usage in v0.8.0 due to expanded FFI layer - mostly for logging, callbacks, and FFI abstraction

samples.code: extern "C" fn start_routine<'thread, FF, TT>(args: *mut posix::void) -> *mut posix::void

extern_keyword.note: Significant increase from v0.7.0 (48 -> 976) due to expanded C/C++ FFI bindings

unsafe_keyword.safety_note: CRITICAL - requires individual review for each occurrence. Increased from 2437 in v0.7.0 due to expanded FFI layer

samples.code: KeyType: Send + Sync + Eq + Clone + Debug + 'static + ZeroCopySend + Hash,

union_keyword.note: NEW in v0.8.0 - Union types now used primarily in FFI layer for C bindings. ZeroCopySend now supports unions (#1144)
union_keyword.safety_note: CHANGED - Union types are inherently unsafe to access. Review FFI layer unions for memory safety.

safe_keyword.note: Used for safe extern functions qualifier - minimal

constructs_not_used.safety_benefit: byte literals used instead for ASCII

constructs_requiring_review.risk: Unsafe field access, memory layout concerns
constructs_requiring_review.action: Review FFI union types for memory safety
Consider fixed-point alternative for ASIL B
Review all extern "C" functions for ABI compatibility

version_comparison.explanation: Increase primarily due to expanded C/C++ FFI bindings in iceoryx2-ffi crate
